page.title: 05Farming, Mr. Stirling.
page.content: Mr.Stirling was moving some cows to another field and we took the chance to interview him for our project.He said he was very glad to be involved.Mr.Stirling has a dairy/arable farm of l,400 acres and 120 cattle.He plants potatoes,oil seed rape,barley,wheat and flax.Throughout the year,he works an average of nine hours a day.Some of his jobs depend on the weather.One of his wet-weather jobs is dressing potatoes.This means picking out the stones and bad potatoes before putting them into boxes for sale or keeping for seed. Mr.Stirling started on the farm twenty-seven years ago when he was fifteen years of age. A great many things have changed. Machines now do most of the work that used to be done by men.
